newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Bosnian presidents fail to agree on ministers.
newsitem.headline: Bosnian presidents fail to agree on ministers.

text.p: Bosnia's three-man presidency failed to agree on Friday how to organise a government.
"The Presidency reached an agreement on general competencies of the Council of Ministers, but no agreement was reached on the organisation of the Council of Ministers," a joint statement said.

According to the Dayton agreement which ended Bosnia's war, the country should be run by a cabinet that includes a prime minister, foreign and foreign trade ministers, and "other ministers according to need".
The joint statement said the Presidency chairman and Moslem leader Alija Izetbegovic and the Croat representative Kresimir Zubak argued that the council should include a chairman and five ministers.
Serb represntative Momcilo Krajisnik insisted a Prime Minister and two ministers should be appointed, who would then report on expanding the ministry.
Despite arguing about the ministry, the trio accepted an agenda for a conference in Paris on implementing the Dayton accords.
Diplomats say they hope the three men will agree on the council of ministers before the conference meets next Thursday.

The Sarajevo-based newsagency Oslobodjenje quoted the office of the international High Representative as saying while November 14 was not a formal deadline for resolving the issue, it would be "in Bosnia's interests to complete the job before the Paris conference."
The meeting was the sixth time the three ethnic leaders have met since they were elected to the presidency in September.
